The following is a list of squads for each national team competing at the [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012]] in Poland and Ukraine. The tournament started on 8 June and the [[UEFA Euro 2012 Final|final]] took place in [[Kiev]] on 1 July 2012.

Each national team had to submit a squad of 23 players, three of whom must be goalkeepers, by 29 May 2012.<ref name="French squad">{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr/bleus/actu/541744_deux-pre-listes-devoilees-le-9-et-15-mai | language=French | title=Deux pré-listes dévoilées le 9 et 15 mai | trans_title=Two shortlists unveiled on 9 and 15 May | date=2 May 2012}}</ref> If a player was injured severely enough to prevent his participation in the tournament before his team's first match, he could be replaced by another player.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/multimediafiles/download/competitions/euro/91/87/57/918757_download.pdf |title=Regulations of the UEFA European Football Championship 2006/08 |accessdate=2 May 2012 |format=PDF |publisher=UEFA |page=22 }}</ref>

''Club memberships are correct as of 2011&ndash;12 season. Caps and goals correct as of 18 June 2012. Ages are correct as of 8 June 2012, the opening day of the tournament.''

==Group A==

=== Poland ===
Coach: [[Franciszek Smuda]]

On 2 May 2012, Smuda named a provisional list of 26 players for the tournament, along with a seven-man reserve list.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1792741.html | title=Smuda picks Poland's provisional EURO squad | date=3 May 2012 | work=UEFA.com | publisher=[[UEFA]]}}</ref> [[Łukasz Fabiański]] withdrew from the squad on 26 May 2012 with a shoulder injury and was replaced by [[Grzegorz Sandomierski]] from the reserve list; Smuda named his 23-man final squad the following day.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1802686.html | title=Poland confirm UEFA EURO 2012 party | date=27 May 2012 | work=UEFA.com | publisher=[[UEFA]]}}</ref>

=== Russia ===
Coach: {{flagicon|Netherlands}} [[Dick Advocaat]]

On 11 May 2012, Advocaat named a provisional list of 26 players for the tournament.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1796048.html | work=UEFA.com | title=Untried duo in provisional Russia squad | date=11 May 2012}}</ref> [[Vasili Berezutski]] and [[Roman Shishkin]] withdrew on 20 and 24 May respectively, Berezutski with a thigh injury and Shishkin due to a stomach complaint.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1799914.html | work=UEFA.com | title=Berezutski ruled out of Russia's EURO campaign | date=20 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1801690.html | work=UEFA.com | title=Russia shorn of Shishkin for EURO | date=24 May 2012}}</ref> Advocaat named his final squad on 25 May 2012; [[Kirill Nababkin]] was named having not been included in the provisional party.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://rfs.ru/main/news/ct131/73916.html| language = Russian | title = Advocaat announced the finalized Euro Squad|date=25 May 2012}}</ref>

=== Netherlands ===
Coach: [[Bert van Marwijk]]

On 7 May 2012, van Marwijk named a provisional list of 36 players for the tournament.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.knvb.nl/nieuws/22148/van-marwijk-kiest-36-internationals | title=VAN MARWIJK KIEST 36 INTERNATIONALS | date=7 May 2012 | work=knvb.nl | publisher=[[Royal Dutch Football Association|KNVB]]}}</ref> However, [[Erik Pieters]] was forced to pull out of the squad shortly after the announcement with a foot injury.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/2898/euro-2012/2012/05/07/3085450/pieters-pulls-out-of-netherlands-provisional-squad-for-euro?utm_source=twitterfeed&utm_medium=twitter | title=Pieters pulls out of Netherlands' provisional squad for Euro 2012 | date=7 May 2012 | work=goal.com | publisher=goal.com}}</ref> On 15 May 2012, van Marwijk reduced his squad to 27 players.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1797413.html | title=Van Marwijk cuts provisional Dutch squad to 27 | date=15 May 2012 | work=UEFA.com}}</ref> On 26 May 2012, van Marwijk announced his 23-man squad for the tournament.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1802333.html | title=Bouma and Willems make final Dutch squad | date=26 May 2012 | work=UEFA.com}}</ref>

==Group C==

=== Spain ===
Coach: [[Vicente del Bosque]]

Vicente del Bosque named a squad to play in a set of warm-up matches on 15 May 2012, but it did not include any [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], [[Athletic Bilbao]], or [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] players as the two Spanish sides were preparing for the [[Copa del Rey]] final on 25 May, while Chelsea were to take on [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] in the Champions League final on 19 May.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1797262.html | title=Atlético trio in Spain friendly party | date=15 May 2012 | publisher=[[UEFA.com]]}}</ref> On 21 May 2012, del Bosque called-up Chelsea players [[Fernando Torres]] and [[Juan Mata]] for the friendly matches.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/news/newsid=1634965.html | title=Spain add Mata, Torres to squad | date=21 May 2012 | publisher=[[FIFA.com]]}}</ref> On 27 May, del Bosque gave the final squad list, complete with Barcelona and Athletic Bilbao players.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1802684.html | title=Holders Spain include Pedro in final EURO squad | date=27 May 2012 | publisher=[[UEFA.com]]}}</ref>

=== Republic of Ireland ===
Coach: {{flagicon|Italy}} [[Giovanni Trapattoni]]

On 7 May 2012, Giovanni Trapattoni announced his 23-man squad list for Euro 2012, along with a five-man stand-by list.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1794010.html|title=McCarthy out as Trapattoni names Ireland squad|date=7 May 2012|publisher=Union of European Football Associations}}</ref> [[Keith Fahey]] withdrew with a groin injury on 26 May and was replaced by [[Paul Green (footballer born 1983)|Paul Green]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1802514.html|title=UEFA EURO 2012 dream over for Ireland's Fahey|date=26 May 2012|publisher=Union of European Football Associations}}</ref> On 29 May 2012 [[Kevin Foley (footballer)|Kevin Foley]] was replaced by [[Paul McShane (Irish footballer)|Paul McShane]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2012/may/29/euro-2012-republic-ireland-squad|title=Kevin Foley dropped from Republic of Ireland squad|date= 29 May 2012|work=Guardian|accessdate=29 May 2012 }}</ref> The Ireland team was the only squad at the tournament to consist entirely of players from foreign leagues.

=== England ===
Coach: [[Roy Hodgson]]

Roy Hodgson announced England's 23-man squad on 16 May 2012, along with a five-man stand-by list.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/News/2012/euro-2012-squad-announced-160512 |title=Guy Cochran Names Euro 2012 Squad |date=16 May 2012 |work=TheFA.com |publisher=The Football Association }}</ref> The England team is the only squad to consist entirely of players from their domestic league. On 25 May, [[John Ruddy]] was ruled out with a broken finger; [[Jack Butland]] was called up as his replacement.<ref>{{cite news |title=John Ruddy ruled out of England Euro 2012 squad with injury |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/england/18204979 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation |date=25 May 2012 }}</ref> On 28 May, [[Gareth Barry]] was ruled out with a groin injury, being replaced by [[Phil Jagielka]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Euro 2012: Injury rules Gareth Barry out of Euros |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18232535 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation |date=28 May 2012 }}</ref> On 31 May, [[Frank Lampard]] was ruled out with a thigh injury and was replaced by [[Jordan Henderson]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Euro 2012: England's Frank Lampard ruled out through injury|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18265377|work=BBC Sport|publisher=[[British Broadcasting Corporation]]|date=31 May 2012}}</ref> On 3 June, [[Gary Cahill]] was ruled out with a double fracture of his jaw and [[Martin Kelly]] was called up as his replacement.

=== France ===
Coach: [[Laurent Blanc]]

Blanc named his first shortlist on 9 May 2012, consisting of 12 players playing abroad.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1795198.html | title=Ben Arfa selected by France coach Blanc | date=9 May 2012 | publisher=[[UEFA.com]]}}</ref> On 15 May 2012 second shortlist of 15 France-based players was announced, while on the same day [[Tottenham Hotspur|Tottenham]] defender [[Younès Kaboul]] was ruled out of the tournament with a knee injury, leaving Blanc with a 26-man squad.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1797369.html | title=Yanga-Mbiwa earns surprise France call-up | date=15 May 2012 | publisher=[[UEFA.com]]}}</ref> On 29 May 2012, Blanc announced his final 23-man squad.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1803196.html | title=Blanc finds no place for Gourcuff, Yanga-Mbiwa | date=29 May 2012 | publisher=[[UEFA.com]]}}</ref>
